DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Tissue Receive And Dissection Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Name Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the BPV SOP governing receipt and dissection of surgical tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Tissue Receive And Dissection Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._To take, accept, or get something offered._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure._A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Tissue Receive And Dissection Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:To take, accept, or get something offered.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.:A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.
An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.
